meanings.definition: To sing with frequent changes from the ordinary voice to falsetto and back again.
meanings.sent1: She loves to yodle when she's happy.
meanings.sent2: He decided to yodle along with the radio.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to yodle along with the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to yodle through the trees on that stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The children yodle joyfully as they play in the park.

meanings.definition: A song sung with frequent changes from the ordinary voice to falsetto and back again.
meanings.sent1: The yodle echoed through the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She listened to a beautiful yodle on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The yodle of the birds in the morning was a cheerful wake-up call.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a yodle-like quality that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The yodle of the flute filled the room with a haunting melody.
